definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
to beat the gong to clear the way/(fig.) to pave the way for sth

sentences.english: Your friend walks in front with the cane to clear the way.
sentences.chinese: 你朋友手持拐棍在前面开道。

sentences.english: Thus saith the LORD, which maketh a way in the sea, and a path in the mighty waters;
sentences.chinese: 耶和华在沧海中开道，在大水中开路。

sentences.english: Some people say death is necessary to make way for the new born.
sentences.chinese: 有人说，死亡是为新生铺路开道的必然。

definition: to open up a path/to make one's way through/to construct a road/(electricity) open circuit
to beat the gong to clear the way/(fig.) to pave the way for sth
to lead the way/to guide/to show the way/fig. to instruct
to get out of the way/to step aside
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
